main event: A civilian in Caledonia, West Ontario reported a bright light descending at an angle for approximately 10 minutes, eventually disappearing behind trees. The observer was convinced it was not an aircraft or balloon.
interesting points: The bright light was estimated to be 1000 feet above ground and diminished in brightness as it descended.
The object had a slight swishing sound when it began to descend.
The witness could not explain what the object was, and it was not identified as an aircraft or balloon.

A minister from Caledonia, east of Ontario, reported seeing a shiny, disc-shaped object approximately 30 feet in diameter, with a dark red or purple glow around the outer edge, flying at an estimated 5,000 feet altitude.

A hand-drawn diagram labeled 'The Launcher' showed a side-view profile of a UFO with dimensions indicating a length of 20' and a height of 10'. The object had a dome on top, a bulge on the bottom, made a humming sound, and gave off a bright light.
sighted object: bright light and a shiny, disc-shaped object with dark red or purple glow
